channel.title: easy on blog
channel.description: Recent content in easy on blog

item.title: 257. Binary Tree Paths
item.description: https://leetcode.com/problems/binary-tree-paths/ Problem Statement: Given a binary tree, return all root-to-leaf paths. Note: A leaf is a node with no children. Examples 1: Input: 1 / \ 2 3 \ 5 Output: ["1->2->5", "1->3"] Explanation: All root-to-leaf paths are: 1->2->5, 1->3 Idea: The most intuitive way is to use a recursion here. One is going through the tree by considering at each step the node itself and its children.

item.title: 100. Same Tree
item.description: https://leetcode.com/problems/same-tree/ Given two binary trees, write a function to check if they are the same or not. Two binary trees are considered the same if they are structurally identical and the nodes have the same value. Idea: Recursively check each node in each tree. If both are null, we’ve gone off the end so return true If one is null and the other isn’t, there is a difference. If one has a val that isn’t equal to the other, there is a difference.
